channel.title: Live patching Axoloti
channel.description: Hi Axoloti crew, please, it there any possibility for patching (connect and disconnect modules + changing values) in Live mode? Something like at nord modular editor. Some delays for compiling and sending from computer to board is ok i think... Thank you.

item.title: Live patching Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @analogrunner
item.description:
@analogrunner wrote:

Hi there, last johaness's post about live patching i found here http://community.axoloti.com/t/the-path-towards-axoloti-2-0/5599/101?u=analogrunner. its 2 years ago. is there any move? or end of believe?
thanks

Read full topic

thanks for answer, so - im waiting and i hope that it will implement;)

Read full topic

item.title: Live patching Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Live patching is absolutely possible technically. There are some architectural barriers in the design of the current system that make it harder to achieve than it should be. There's disagreement on this point, but I'm of the opinion that it should have been a feature from day one. An architecture that allows for live patching has a bunch of other benefits as well that make the system easier to work with. It forces the patcher to be more decoupled from the firmware. It forces us to have a clearly defined DSP API. I also think it could be done in a way that preserves overall performance; that's a common criticism of the idea. It really comes down to committing developer time to do the changes completely and not trying to graft them onto the existing architecture.

I'll leave it there for now, but if you're interested in more detail about what I think the correct architecture is, let me know.

Read full topic

I’m glad this isn’t a feature I want.

item.title: Live patching Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @axoman
item.description:
@axoman wrote:

Here's the most recent thread he made about it ...

The path towards Axoloti 2.0 Developer
I'll try to shine some light on my development plans: When arriving closer to a fresh release, I was hitting a hard wall. One was getting a perfectly nice working undo-redo, the "live" switch barrier is not one that can be crossed nicely by undo-redo operations. Recompilation by launching gcc is not snappy enough. A second issue was sharing code along objects and avoiding name-conflicts, I was not really happy with the "modules" approach (in the experimental branch on github). So I've been t…

Read full topic
